macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Decline Amid Hotter PPI and Bank Earnings Pressure
items.summary: Major indices fell on January 14, 2026: Dow down 0.5-0.8% to around 49,191, S&P 500 down 0.19-0.94% to 6,898-6,963, Nasdaq down 0.10-1.5% with tech stocks like Broadcom, Nvidia, and Oracle leading declines. Tech retreated after hotter-than-expected PPI data, while energy and defensive stocks gained.

items.title: Bank Stocks Drag Dow Lower Despite Softer Core CPI Data
items.summary: US equities retreated overnight with banks leading declines due to new credit card law proposals; Dow fell 0.80% to 49,191, S&P 500 slipped 0.19% to 6,963, Nasdaq eased 0.10% to 23,709. Treasury yields stable, DXY up 0.28% to 99.17.

items.title: Gold and Silver Futures Hit Record Highs Amid Market Volatility
items.summary: Silver set a new all-time high near $92, gold neared records at $4,609.50 up 0.23%, while oil rallied with Brent up 2.43% to $65.42 and WTI up 2.69% to $61.10 on Iranian supply risks. Commodities mixed as stocks fell.

items.title: Upcoming US Data and Fed Speakers in Focus After Mixed Economic Signals
items.summary: Markets await PPI (exp +0.2%), Retail Sales (exp +0.5%), Existing Home Sales, and speeches from Fed officials including Miran, Bostic, Williams, Kashkari, and Paulson. Prior data showed softer Core CPI but resilient ISM Services PMI.

items.title: Supreme Court Delays Key Decisions on Trump Tariffs and Voting Rights
items.summary: US Supreme Court postponed rulings on Trump tariffs and Voting Rights Act cases, contributing to market uncertainty alongside hotter PPI report and tech selloff.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Surges Past $95,000 Amid Cooling Inflation and CLARITY Act Progress
items.summary: Bitcoin extended gains to trade above $95,500 on January 14, driven by cooling U.S. inflation data and advancing momentum behind the Digital Asset Market Clarity Act (CLARITY Act), which aims to clarify regulatory splits between the SEC and CFTC.

items.title: Ethereum Holds Above $3,300 as Total Crypto Market Cap Approaches $3.25 Trillion
items.summary: Major altcoins extended their gains alongside Bitcoin, with Ethereum maintaining levels above $3,300 and the total cryptocurrency market capitalization rising toward $3.25 trillion.

items.title: Institutional Money Returns to Crypto Markets as January Momentum Builds
items.summary: Cryptocurrency markets are experiencing a strategic reset in 2026 with institutional capital returning steadily, increased trading volumes, and accelerating stablecoin inflows, marking Bitcoin's first push past $90,000 since the 2021 cycle.

items.title: Crypto Rally Extends for Second Consecutive Day Following Holiday Lull
items.summary: Cryptocurrency markets continued their positive momentum on January 14, marking the second straight day of gains after a relatively flat holiday season.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Scientists Demonstrate First-Time Use of AI for Genetic Circuit Design and Prediction
items.summary: Researchers at Houston have successfully used AI and machine learning to analyze and predict the function of untested genetic circuits, marking the first time ML models have been applied at this scale. The CLASSIC platform tested vast numbers of complete circuits and found ML models to be more accurate than traditional physics-based approaches.

items.title: AI Adoption Among Scientists Creates Winners and Laggards in Natural Sciences
items.summary: A Nature study analyzing 41 million papers found that scientists using AI publish three times more papers and receive five times more citations than non-adopters. However, the research also reveals that AI-driven work concentrates on crowded problems, potentially narrowing overall scientific exploration.

items.title: Data Quality Emerges as Critical Challenge for AI Implementation in 2026
items.summary: Industry surveys reveal that 44% of companies cite data quality as their biggest concern for 2026, with only 35% having clean, centralized data for AI agents. Poor data quality has caused 52% of AI projects to fail in financial services.

items.title: AI Becomes Operational Necessity for Anti-Money Laundering Compliance
items.summary: Banks are rapidly adopting AI for AML systems to address limitations of legacy rule-based approaches, which generate 90-95% false positives. AI-driven transaction monitoring and anomaly detection are transforming compliance operations across financial institutions.

items.title: Trump Executive Order on AI Generates Mixed Reactions from Medical Device Manufacturers
items.summary: A new executive order on artificial intelligence has prompted both praise and confusion among medical device manufacturers regarding regulatory implications and implementation requirements.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Meta Cuts 10% of Reality Labs Staff, Closes Major VR Game Studios
items.summary: Meta is laying off approximately 1,500 employees from its Reality Labs division and closing first-party game development studios including Armature Studios, Sanzaru Games, Twisted Pixel, and Within. The closures affect development of popular VR titles like Deadpool VR, Asgard's Wrath 2, and Resident Evil 4 VR.

items.title: Nintendo, Sony, and Microsoft Update Shared Player Safety Principles
items.summary: The three major gaming console manufacturers announced updated shared commitments to player safety, reflecting new technological innovations and collaborative approaches to protect players, especially children, across their platforms.

items.title: Rockstar Games Launches Official Mod Marketplace
items.summary: Following its 2023 acquisition of Cfx.re, Rockstar Games has launched the Cfx Marketplace, offering free and paid mods for GTA V and Red Dead Redemption 2.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Wolfspeed Achieves Industry-First 300mm Silicon Carbide Wafer Production
items.summary: Wolfspeed announced successful production of a 300mm (12-inch) single-crystal silicon carbide (SiC) wafer, marking a major semiconductor manufacturing milestone. The achievement is backed by the company's extensive SiC intellectual property portfolio of over 2,300 patents.
